column4: Hey, I'm having trouble mounting an external harddrive, anyone on to help?
If anyone knows anything at all, it'd be helping more than google is right now.
Okay, so I plug in my external, and it says "unable to mount 871 GB filesystem" Exit code is 12: NTFS signature is missing.
Then a second one pops up saying the same thing, but 329 or whatever (GBs)
.. I just did.
... so lets pretend I'm totally new to Ubuntu... and linux in general... see, my ex installed it on my laptop, and I never had a problem with it before now.
Yes, I do. and it works fine on windows 7
Sounds like you mounted it in windows and failed to "Safely Remove Hardware", in win?
Other than that, a hardware problem with the HD, itself; perhaps you could run 'Disk Utility' from System--> Administration..
like this?
After we work out the ext HD problem, have a look here for a general 'How-to' for Ubuntu: http://www.psychocats.net/ubuntu/index
This is another, general, good one:.. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ubuntu_%28operating_system%29
Go to System-->Administration--> Disk Utility and have a look, there.
It shows up in the DU... which is weird...
but if I open the home folder, and try to click on the harddrive, it says "Cannot mount"
Also, why does it list my harddrive as 2 HDD?
What usr13 said.. 2 HDD is probably the Name you used for the disk in Win.
In win, run chkdsk to fix errors.
Two partitions on the drive.
It's not partitioned though. Plus in the Disk Utility it shows up as one.
